title: 108_hr4884
content: Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area boundary adjustment. The Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area boundaries are amended to include the riverfront and downtown areas, with specific coordinates and exceptions outlined in the amendment to Section 3(b) of the Act. The boundaries of the Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area are expanded to include the riverfront and downtown areas, with specific coordinates and exceptions outlined in the amendment to Section 3(b) of the Act. The expansion includes Quechan Road/Penitentiary Avenue, the north full bank line of the Colorado River, 23rd Avenue, and the southern right-of-way line of the Yuma Valley Levee/Yuma Valley Railroad right-of-way. The expansion of the Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area includes specific coordinates and exceptions, extending from Quechan Road/Penitentiary Avenue to the southern right-of-way line of the Yuma Valley Levee/Yuma Valley Railroad. It continues along Lovers Lane, First Street, an alleyway between 1st and 2nd Avenues, and Giss Parkway, with defined distances and intersections. The expansion of the Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area includes specific coordinates and exceptions, extending from Quechan Road/Penitentiary Avenue to the southern right-of-way line of the Yuma Valley Levee/Yuma Valley Railroad. It continues along Lovers Lane, First Street, an alleyway between 1st and 2nd Avenues, and Giss Parkway, with defined distances and intersections, including 2nd Avenue, 4th Street, an alleyway between 3rd and 4th Avenues, 5th Street, and 4th Avenue. The expansion of the Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area includes specific coordinates and exceptions, extending from Quechan Road/Penitentiary Avenue to the southern right-of-way line of the Yuma Valley Levee/Yuma Valley Railroad. It continues along Lovers Lane, First Street, an alleyway between 1st and 2nd Avenues, and Giss Parkway, with defined distances and intersections, including 2nd Avenue, 4th Street, an alleyway between 3rd and 4th Avenues, 5th Street, and 4th Avenue. From there, the route extends easterly along 6th Street, then southerly along an alleyway between 3rd and 4th Avenues, followed by easterly along 7th Street, southerly along 3rd Avenue, and finally easterly along 8th Street. The curr_chunk describes the path starting from the intersection of 8th Street and Madison Avenue, then along 5th Street to the Union Pacific/Southern Pacific Railroad right-of-way, and finally along Prison Lane. The path starts at the intersection of Prison Lane and the Gila River Levee, then continues along the levee for a total distance of 17,395 ft to the southwest section corner of Township 8 South, Range 22 West, Section 19.
